headline: Analysis-Old meets new economy: AI boom to supercharge European banks' rally
summary: After a stellar 2025, investors expect shares in European banks to keep heading higher in 2026, supported by strong earnings and, crucially, cost savings stemming from artificial intelligence.  As fears of a recession and interest rate cuts from the European Central Bank have subsided, investors have turned ​even more positive towards European banks, revising up their expectations for the sector, despite a complicated backdrop.  Meanwhile, AI  has emerged as a new force drawing investors to ‌European lenders' shares, partly because a dearth of technology companies in the region has forced many to hunt for AI beneficiaries in old-economy markets.

content.title: Analysis-Old meets new economy: AI boom to supercharge European banks' rally
content.summary: After a stellar 2025, investors expect shares in European banks to keep heading higher in 2026, supported by strong earnings and, crucially, cost savings stemming from artificial intelligence.  As fears of a recession and interest rate cuts from the European Central Bank have subsided, investors have turned ​even more positive towards European banks, revising up their expectations for the sector, despite a complicated backdrop.  Meanwhile, AI  has emerged as a new force drawing investors to ‌European lenders' shares, partly because a dearth of technology companies in the region has forced many to hunt for AI beneficiaries in old-economy markets.

headline: DIFC becomes top five global hub for hedge fund managers - over 100 hedge funds now registered in the Centre
summary: DIFC, the leading global financial centre in the Middle East, Africa and South Asia region, has registered its 100th hedge fund, reflecting its dominance in the sector and successful journey to becoming a top five global hub for the industry.

content.title: DIFC becomes top five global hub for hedge fund managers - over 100 hedge funds now registered in the Centre
